revised_title: Steroid Metabolism in Human Testis: Role of Interstitium and Seminiferous Tubules
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on tissue samples from three men to study the role of interstitium and seminiferous tubules in steroid metabolism in the human testis. They found that both components are capable of steroid metabolism and that whole tissue incubations alone can be misleading. The study helps to understand the different physiological roles of steroids produced by each component and their potential involvement in male reproductive system diseases.
